alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 09 at 2:44PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in South Dakota... James River at Ashton affecting Spink County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in South Dakota... James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. James River at Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, significant amounts of agricultural lands are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.8 feet by next Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued before Thursday evening.
